items.title: Aviom India creditors to go for Swiss challenge
items.summary: In an effort to maximize returns for its lenders, Aviom India Housing Finance is launching a Swiss challenge auction to attract competitive bids. The creditors' committee has dismissed the revival proposal put forth by the promoters. PwC is currently developing the auction guidelines, with an e-auction date set to be announced shortly.

items.title: Power ministry fast-tracks India energy stack development
items.summary: The Power Ministry's recent dialogue with the India Energy Stack taskforce marks a significant step towards innovation in India's energy sector. During this meeting, key strategy and architectural documents were scrutinized, laying the groundwork for a cohesive, safe, and interoperable digital ecosystem.

items.title: Indian economy enters virtuous cycle despite global headwinds: RBI
items.summary: India's economic landscape is thriving, underpinned by a surge in investment and enhanced productivity. Even in the face of global hurdles, the nation stands firm, showcasing resilience unlike any other. Both urban and rural demand are on the rise, signaling a strong recovery.

items.title: Rising component costs may force cos to pull plug on entry-level 5G phones
items.summary: Entry-level 5G smartphone prices are rising due to increased component costs. This trend threatens the rapid growth seen in this segment. Handset manufacturers may reduce production or exit the market. The cost of memory, crucial for these devices, is climbing significantly. This situation could delay the widespread adoption of 5G technology across India. Telecom operators are observing these developments closely.

items.title: NPPA extends price cap on knee implants by a year
items.summary: India's drug pricing regulator has extended the price cap on knee implants. This decision will continue to benefit patients by keeping costs down. The National Pharmaceutical Pricing Authority decided not to revise the prices for another year. Manufacturers had argued for a price increase, citing research and development needs.

items.title: Air India steps up efforts to win back customers
items.summary: Air India is preparing a significant product overhaul. New planes and upgraded interiors are planned. This initiative aims to attract customers following a tragic plane crash. Significant changes will be noticeable by 2026. The airline is also investing in a new training academy. Delivery of new aircraft is expected next year. Exclusive customer lounges are also planned.

items.title: Campa, Lahori Zeera steal Coca-Cola, PepsiCo's thunder as market shifts
items.summary: Newer soft drink brands, Campa and Lahori Zeera, are making a strong impact on the Indian market. They have doubled their combined market share, taking business from established giants Coca-Cola and PepsiCo. This shift is happening despite the new brands not being available nationwide and a challenging summer.

items.title: Government firming up changes to EPF, pension and insurance schemes for gig workers
items.summary: In a significant move to enhance protection for gig and platform workers, new social security schemes are being crafted. These changes are expected to benefit more than 70 million EPFO subscribers, integrating them into a structured social safety net. Companies will soon have simplified pathways for compliance as the government gears up to announce these initiatives.

items.title: RBI plays onshore and offshore to help rupee have a good day
items.summary: The Indian rupee celebrated a remarkable recovery, showcasing its most significant one-day increase in a month by settling at 89.23 to the US dollar. The Reserve Bank of India's preemptive dollar sales before market hours seem to have played a crucial role in this revival from the brink of an all-time low.

items.title: India, Canada can deepen ties in AI, critical minerals, nuclear energy: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: Exciting developments are on the horizon as India and Canada prepare to elevate their trade and investment relationship. With talks on a free trade agreement rekindled, both nations recognize the untapped potential in sectors like critical minerals, nuclear energy, and artificial intelligence.

items.title: Rekha Gupta govt's big decision as Delhi battles 430+ AQI amid 'severe' air pollution
items.summary: As Delhiites suffering from worst air quality, Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta has taken decisive action to reduce pollution exposure among employees working from offices.

items.title: India spends big with credit cards in ecommerce, fest tango
items.summary: October witnessed a remarkable 19.6% rise in credit card expenditures in India, thanks to the surge in online shopping activities and festive buying sprees. Conversely, the influx of new credit card sign-ups has significantly tapered off.

items.title: Centre begins audit of stuck green projects
items.summary: The renewable energy ministry is conducting a case-by-case assessment of pending green energy projects lacking power sale agreements, with a detailed analysis expected in 30-45 days. This comes as 43.9 GW of awarded projects face issues due to a shift in demand towards continuous renewable power with storage.

items.title: PSU oil companies hit 54% of FY26 capex goal
items.summary: State-run oil and gas companies have spent ₹71,000 crore, 54% of their annual capex target, with ONGC leading spending. This investment covers drilling, exploration, and recovery projects. Indian Oil Corp and BPCL also reported significant expenditures, though at different paces, while Oil India showed the fastest spending utilization.

items.title: Engineering goods exports slide 17%; Industry seeks EU tariff relief
items.summary: In October, Indian engineering goods exports dropped by 17%, prompting exporters to push for special exemptions on stainless steel products in ongoing trade negotiations with the European Union. This request arises amidst the EU's plans to impose increased tariffs and reduce duty-free quotas on steel imports.

items.title: Consumption to drive India's growth to 6.5% in FY26, 6.7% in FY27: S&P
items.summary: S&P Global Ratings projects India's economy to grow by 6.5% in 2025-26 and 6.7% in 2026-27, with consumption driving growth. Despite US tariffs impacting exports, domestic momentum remains strong. The agency anticipates a potential trade agreement with the US, which could boost labor-intensive sectors and strengthen the rupee.

items.title: Highway push: Centre races to slash project delays by March
items.summary: India is accelerating its efforts to finalize numerous overdue highway initiatives by March, targeting a reduction in excess expenses and a faster pace of new road development. By hastening clearances and land acquisition, the government is paving the way for construction firms to meet their deadlines effectively.

items.title: Amazon faces scrutiny over ‘Trojan horse’ actions in Italy amid smuggling, customs law violations, tax fraud allegations
items.summary: Italian police raided two Amazon sites in an investigation into alleged customs and tax fraud involving Chinese imports. The probe may expand across the EU as prosecutors suspect smuggling and violations of customs laws.

items.title: Rick Cotton, Head of NY and NJ’s Port Authority, to Retire
items.summary: Rick Cotton, the executive director of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, who oversaw major revitalization efforts and infrastructure developments across New York City and parts of New Jersey, will retire in January, the agency announced on Monday.

items.title: Government appoints new executive directors in Canara Bank, Union Bank, Bank of Maharashtra, Indian Bank and PNB
items.summary: The government has appointed Sunil Kumar Chugh and Amresh Prasad as EDs in Canara Bank and Union Bank of India, respectively, along with other senior appointments in Bank of Maharashtra, Indian Bank, and PNB for three-year tenures.

items.title: Court bars Tesla Power's ads for now, amid brand dispute
items.summary: The Delhi High Court has stopped Tesla Power India from advertising electric vehicle products using the 'Tesla' brand. This comes as Elon Musk's Tesla Inc filed a trademark infringement case. The court's order will remain until the main petition is decided. Tesla Power India is barred from using the mark for batteries and related automotive systems.

items.title: Interference due to BSNL Network, Tejas tells Airtel
items.summary: Tejas Networks denies Bharti Airtel's accusation that its equipment caused network interference in Rajasthan. Tejas states the issue stems from Airtel's sites being too close to BSNL's network, increasing noise. The company asserts its radios meet all specifications and have been thoroughly tested. Tejas suggests Airtel collaborate with BSNL to install filters at additional sites to resolve the interference.

items.title: Boeings troubled capsule wont carry astronauts on next space station flight
items.summary: Boeing's troubled capsule won't carry astronauts on next space station flight

items.title: ESAF Financial Holdings submits fresh proposal to bring down ownership in ESAF Bank
items.summary: ESAF Small Finance Bank's promoter, ESAF Financial Holdings, has submitted a revised plan to the RBI to reduce its stake. The new proposal ensures Dia Vikas Capital's shareholding stays below 5%, a change from the previous 12.17% that was rejected. This move aims to provide exits for existing shareholders and introduce new ones, ultimately lowering the promoter's stake.

items.title: Hayli Gubbi Volcano eruption: Air India, IndiGo and Akasa Air issue updates on flight delays amid ash cloud drift over India
items.summary: Indian aviation is on high alert. Ash clouds from Ethiopia's Hayli Gubbi volcano are moving towards western and northern India. Flights are already experiencing disruptions and diversions. Authorities are monitoring the situation closely. Passengers should check flight statuses frequently. More detours and delays are possible overnight.

items.title: Gold loans dominate increase in retail credit growth: CRIF
NBFC AUM to grow at 19%, cross ₹50 lakh crore next fiscal: Crisil Ratings

items.summary: In view of the eruption of Ethiopia's Hayli Gubbi volcano, India's aviation regulator, DGCA, has issued an advisory to airlines and airports.

items.title: Sunteck Realty makes Dubai debut with a  ₹10,000 crore luxury project
items.summary: The Mumbai-based developer has set up a new entity—Sunteck International—to develop projects in the United Arab Emirates.

items.title: Singaporean energy firm Sembcorp plans IPO of Indian unit, sources say
items.summary: Sembcorp’s Indian arm, Sembcorp Green Infra, operates businesses in wind, solar and energy storage, and competes with the likes of Adani Green Energy and Avaada Group

items.summary: It will help unlock green growth, a new financial opportunity, SBI Ventures Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer Prem Prabhakar said

items.title: 'Hopefully we are going to sign': Israeli Amb Azar on India-Israel FTA deal
items.summary: India and Israel are nearing a Free Trade Agreement. Israeli Ambassador Reuven Azar expressed optimism following the signing of Terms of Reference. He also inaugurated a Centre of Excellence for vegetables in Assam. This facility showcases Israeli agricultural technology. It aims to boost crop diversity and productivity in the region. This marks a deepening partnership in agriculture.

items.title: Mumbai Int'l Airport handles record single-day air traffic movement Nov 21
items.summary: Mumbai International Airport achieved a new record on November 21, handling 1,036 air traffic movements, driven by festive demand. This surpassed its previous best, with the airport also reporting near-record passenger traffic on the same day. Domestic routes saw high activity, alongside strong international travel to key global destinations.

items.title: India, Afghanistan discuss ways to boost textile trade
items.summary: India and Afghanistan are exploring ways to boost textile trade, with Kabul seeking to leverage India's expertise as a major cotton producer. Discussions focused on strengthening Afghanistan's textile sector, creating jobs, and enhancing farmer training. India is already a significant supplier of textiles and apparel to Afghanistan.

items.title: Sebi to review Basic Services Demat Account: From ZCZP bonds to digital consent — Here's what could change
items.summary: SEBI is reviewing the Basic Services Demat Account facility to enhance ease of investment and business. Public comments are invited until December 15. Here's all that could change based on the proposal…

items.summary: Auto, electronics, and aerospace among key MoU sectors

items.summary: She has served in various positions holding the rank of Zonal Manager in Pune, Bangalore and New Delhi Zones

items.title: India’s economy gains momentum, but RBI cautions on global stock exuberance
items.summary: India's economy shows resilience with robust growth in manufacturing and services, supported by GST reforms, according to the Reserve Bank of India's report. However, global market volatility and elevated equity valuations raise concerns for financial stability.

items.summary: Flow of financial resources from Banks to commercial sector increased to ₹11,12,687 crore from ₹9,80,394 crore a year ago

items.title: Sales of private, listed, non-financial companies improve in Q2, says RBI data
items.summary: The RBI released data on performance of private corporate business sector in Q2 of FY26, based on the results of 3,118 listed non-government, non-financial companies

items.title: Air India clears most interim compensation claims after crash, expect normalized aircraft deliveries in 2026: CEO Wilson
items.summary: CEO Campbell Wilson confirmed Air India has cleared most interim compensation claims related to the AI171 crash, amounting to  ₹60 crore. He also noted that the carrier's ambitious retrofit programme, meant to upgrade its current fleet, has been delayed to 2028.

items.title: Policymakers-industry collaboration vital for healthcare delivery: Dr Reddy's
items.summary: Dr Reddy's Laboratories chairman Satish Reddy emphasized the need for collaboration between government and industry. This partnership is crucial for creating a healthcare system ready for the future. Reddy shared his views at a pre-budget consultation in New Delhi. He highlighted risk-based innovation funding to boost India's pharmaceutical sector. This aims to accelerate breakthroughs and improve patient access and affordability.

items.title: Huge appetite for private credit from real estate sector
items.summary: This hunger for private capital is largely due to the RBI appropriately maintaining strict limits on bank lending to real estate, to avoid asset bubbles and sub-prime risks

items.summary: Heads of fund houses flag operational challenges and concerns regarding the sharp cost cut

items.title: India on cusp of a virtuous investment cycle despite global headwinds, says RBI report
items.summary: India's economy is poised for robust growth, fueled by rising investment and productivity, according to the RBI. Despite global uncertainties, strong domestic demand, moderating inflation, and ample foreign reserves provide resilience.  Fiscal and monetary measures are expected to foster a virtuous cycle, enhancing long-term economic strength and stability.

items.title: Delhi air pollution protest turns violent: 22 arrested for pepper-spraying police amid worsening AQI
items.summary: New Delhi: Twenty-two people have been arrested for allegedly using pepper spray on police personnel after officers attempted to disperse a group blocking the C-Hexagon stretch near India Gate during a protest against worsening pollution in Delhi-NCR, officials confirmed on Monday.

items.title: New labour codes to push up expenses for real estate sector
items.summary: Baseline construction costs for real estate developers are expected to go up 5-10 per cent due to the increase in labour expenses

items.title: AEIM plans Rs 10,000 cr investment in Raipur-based semicon material plant by 2030
items.summary: AEIM plans a significant Rs 10,000 crore investment in its Raipur semiconductor materials manufacturing facility by 2030. Construction of the state-of-the-art plant, utilizing advanced technology, will begin immediately with the first phase targeted for completion by May 2026. This initiative aims to establish Raipur as a semiconductor hub, generating over 4,000 high-skilled jobs and driving regional economic growth.

items.title: India’s economy turning out to be more resilient to external shocks over time: RBI bulletin
items.summary: October has seen a further pick up in demand conditions pointing towards a resilient growth outlook

items.title: Mumbai airport handles record 1,036 flights on Friday
items.summary: The 1,036 flights recorded on Friday included 520 arrivals and 516 departures

items.title: Thomson launches 55”, 65” & 75” QLED MEMC 120Hz TV series: Dolby Vision, 70W audio, starting Rs 31,999
items.summary: Thomson has launched its latest QLED MEMC 120Hz Smart TV range in India on Monday, November 24. Available in 55-inch, 65-inch, and 75-inch sizes, this new line-up is powered by Google TV 5.0.

items.title: IndiGo, Akasa Air cancel flights as Ethiopian volcano spews ash
items.summary: IndiGo and Akasa Air cancelled a handful of their flights and others were monitoring the situation as plumes of ash from Ethiopia’s Hauli Gubbi volcano swept eastward towards India due to jet streams or air currents

items.title: US travel demand takes a hit; confident about long-term prospects: Air India CEO
items.summary: Air India's CEO, Campbell Wilson, acknowledges a temporary dip in US travel demand due to airspace issues and visa concerns. Despite these challenges, the airline remains confident in the market's long-term prospects and is strategically revamping its fleet, including the Boeing 777s.

items.summary: ‘Concerns persist about the heightened exuberance in global equity markets, raising questions about its sustainability and its implications for financial stability’

items.summary: At 11:40 AM ET, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.54%, the S&amp;P 500 gained 1.33%, the Nasdaq Composite gained 2.26%

items.title: Novo Nordisk stock plummets 12.4% after weight-loss pill Ozempic fails Alzheimer's trials — All you need to know
items.summary: Pharma major Novo Nordisk's stock plummeted a record 12.4% on 24 November after the Danish company's weight-loss pill Ozempic failed trials for Alzheimer's treatment. Extension of the studies have been discontinued. Here's all we know…

items.title: Air India plans major fleet, services upgrade in 2026, says CEO
items.summary: Air India expects to receive two refurbished Boeing 787-8 aircraft undergoing full cabin transformation in Victorville, the US, by February 2026

items.title: Jitendra Singh announces setting up of four quantum fabrication facilities
items.summary: Jitendra Singh, during a visit to IIT-Bombay, said these cutting-edge facilities mark a decisive leap in India's journey toward technological sovereignty, positioning the nation among the select global leaders advancing next-generation quantum technologies.

items.title: IFFI 2025: Borun Thokchom's documentary 'Battlefield' makes its premiere
items.summary: IFFI 2025: The full-length documentary, produced by Manjoy Lourembam, Dr. Radhesyam Oinam, and Viswamithra Universals, delves into the untold history of the fierce Battle of Imphal—one of the decisive turning points of the Second World War—fought between Japanese forces and the Allied troops in Manipur.

items.title: Mumbai Airport Sets Record For Highest Single-Day Air Traffic Movement
items.summary: A total of 1,70,488 passenger movements were recorded on Nov. 21.

items.title: India, EU set to firm up FTA, defence pact, strategic agenda at summit on January 27
items.summary: India and the European Union are strengthening ties with a summit on January 27. A free trade pact, defence agreement, and strategic agenda will be finalized. This partnership aims to shape global governance and boost trade. Both sides are working to resolve outstanding issues in the trade deal.

items.title: Dubai-based DAMAC opens GCC in Noida; plans second facility in Pune
items.summary: The company will also soon set up a GCC in Pune, DAMAC said in a statement. DAMAC Group has launched its new global services arm, DAMAC Shared Services India (DSSI). It has rented 22,622 sq ft office space in Noida to set up the capability centre.

items.summary: Higher monetary benefits, apart from current insurance benefits provided by platforms, could raise per order charges by ₹2-3, which would likely be passed on to consumers

items.summary: Sudeep Pharma's IPO, valued at  ₹895 crore, has garnered healthy interest, with a subscription rate over 5 times. The retail portion was subscribed 5.02 times, while the NII portion saw 12 times subscription. Listing is expected on November 28.

items.summary: Coverage of maize, mustard and gram increases; 50% of normal area likely to be covered this week

items.summary: Prosus, in its half-year update, stated that it has posted an e-commerce revenue growth of 22% (14%) to $3.6 billion, along with asset sales of $1.2 billion to date in FY26

items.title: India’s growth momentum strengthens on festive demand, resilient consumption: RBI Bulletin
items.summary: India's economy accelerated in October, driven by strong festive spending, robust urban and rural consumption, and GST rate cuts. Despite external challenges, demand improved, with digital payments showing continued growth across various sectors. While electricity demand dipped due to unseasonal weather, overall economic activity remained buoyant, particularly in rural areas.

items.summary: The proposals are invited under the Food Safety and Quality Assurance Infrastructure (FSQAI) component of PMKSY, a ministry statement said.

items.summary: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad K Sangma met Union Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu in New Delhi. They discussed expanding Shillong Airport. Sangma also requested including Baljek Airport near Tura in the UDAN scheme. Naidu emphasized that better air connectivity will boost Meghalaya's tourism and economy. This will support farmers and women self-help groups.

items.summary: Investor Michael Burry, who shut his hedge fund Scion Asset Management and returned capital to investors, is focused on his paid newsletter. Here's all we know…

items.title: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw flags off two new MEMU trains from Delhi to Shamli
items.summary: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw launched two new MEMU train services connecting Delhi and Shamli in Uttar Pradesh. These trains will improve travel for students, commuters, and professionals. Shamli railway station is undergoing a Rs 25 crore redevelopment. Since 2014, Uttar Pradesh has seen significant railway expansion, including new tracks and electrification.

items.title: Dr Reddy’s gets EC nod for AVT03: New Prolia and Xgeva biosimilar set to launch across Europe
items.summary: Dr. Reddy's Laboratories has secured European Commission marketing approval for AVT03, a biosimilar to Prolia and Xgeva, used for bone-related conditions. This authorization permits commercial launch across EU member states, Iceland, Liechtenstein, and Norway. Dr. Reddy's will commercialize AVT03, branded as Acvybra and Xbonzy, following a license and supply agreement with Alvotech.

items.summary: SEBI has granted approval for public offerings by Amagi Media Labs, Sahajanand Medical, and Fractal Analytics, paving the way for significant fundraising. The companies will utilize the funds for technology, acquisitions, and general corporate needs, with IPOs managed by top investment firms.

These initiatives aim to boost domestic manufacturing and make industries more climate-friendly, fostering business growth through deregulation.

items.summary: The export landscape for Indian sugar mills is looking increasingly tough, with global sugar prices trailing behind domestic market rates, hindering the initiation of fresh contracts. As a result, the ambitious goal of exporting 1.5 million tons appears out of reach. Nonetheless, this scenario could help stabilize global sugar pricing.

items.title: Indore SEZ exports jump 32 pc due to increased orders from pharma units
items.summary: Exports from Indore's Special Economic Zone have surged by 32 percent. This significant growth reached Rs 8,127.67 crore in the first seven months of the current financial year. Increased orders from pharmaceutical units are the primary driver behind this impressive performance. The United States is a major importer of these pharmaceuticals. The SEZ houses numerous plants across various sectors.

items.summary: While When China recorded a 12.1% drop in production, India’s output increased by 5.9%

items.title: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson says 2026 will be year of visible change
items.summary: Air India anticipates 2026 to be a pivotal year for customer experience, marked by significant fleet upgrades and the induction of new wide-body aircraft. The airline is retrofitting its Boeing 787 fleet with new interiors and in-flight entertainment, aiming for two-thirds to be completed by year-end. This, alongside new aircraft deliveries and service enhancements, is expected to drive substantial improvements.

items.summary: Secretary in Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), Amardeep Singh Bhatia said that in this area, the government is not only looking at introducing new technologies, but also talking about transfer of technologies to promote domestic manufacturing.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
